text: Warning against Alliance with Egypt
“Oh rebellious children!” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 30:1 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“to make a plan, but\f + \fr 30:1 \ft Or “and” \f* not from me,
and pour out a libation, but\f + \fr 30:1 \ft Or “and” \f* not \add from\add* my Spirit,
⸤so as to add⸥\f + \fr 30:1 \ft Literally “for the sake of adding” \f* sin to sin.
Who go to go down \add to\add* Egypt,
but\f + \fr 30:2 \ft Or “and” \f* they do not ask \add of\add* my mouth,
to take refuge in the protection of Pharaoh
and to take refuge in the shadow of Egypt.
And the protection of Pharaoh shall be shame to you,
and the refuge in the shadow of Egypt, humiliation.
For his officials are at Zoan,
and his envoys reach to Hanes.
Everyone will start to stink because of a people \add that\add* cannot profit them,
not for help and not for profiting,
but for shame and also for disgrace.”
Oracle regarding the Negev
An oracle of the animals of the Negev:
Through a land of trouble and distress,
\add of\add* lioness and lion,
⸤among⸥\f + \fr 30:6 \ft Literally “from” \f* them \add are\add* snake and flying serpent;
they carry their wealth on \add the\add* ⸤backs⸥\f + \fr 30:6 \ft Literally “shoulder” \f* of male donkeys
and their treasures on \add the\add* humps\f + \fr 30:6 \ft Hebrew “hump” \f* of camels,
to a people \add that\add* cannot profit \add them\add*.
For\f + \fr 30:7 \ft Or “And” \f* ⸤Egyptians⸥\f + \fr 30:7 \ft Literally “Egypt” \f* help \add with\add* vanity and emptiness,
therefore I have called this one “Rahab, they \add are\add* sitting.”
Now go, write it on a tablet with them,
and inscribe it on a scroll,
⸤that⸥\f + \fr 30:8 \ft Or “and” \f* it may be ⸤for the time to come⸥,\f + \fr 30:8 \ft Literally “for last day” \f*
forever, forever.
For it \add is\add* a people of rebellion, deceitful children,
children \add who are\add* not willing to hear the instruction of Yahweh,
who say to those who do see, “You must not see!”
and to the seers, “You must not see truth for us;
speak smooth things to us,
see illusions,
turn aside from \add the\add* way, turn aside from \add the\add* path,
put an end to the holy one of Israel from our face.”
Therefore the holy one of Israel says this:
“Because you \add are\add* rejecting this word
and you trust in oppression and ⸤cunning⸥\f + \fr 30:12 \ft Literally “going wrong” \f*
and you rely on it,
therefore this iniquity shall come for you like a breach about to fall,
bulging out on a high wall ⸤that breaks⸥\f + \fr 30:13 \ft Literally “whose breaking comes” \f* suddenly, \add in\add* an instant.
And he breaks it like a vessel of ⸤a potter⸥\f + \fr 30:14 \ft Literally “someone who forms” \f* breaks,
\add that\add* is crushed; he has no compassion,
and no potsherd is found among its fragments\f + \fr 30:14 \ft Hebrew “fragment” \f* ⸤to take fire⸥\f + \fr 30:14 \ft Literally “for the taking away of fire” \f* from \add the\add* hearth,
or ⸤to skim⸥\f + \fr 30:14 \ft Literally “for the skimming off of” \f* water from \add the\add* cistern.”
For the Lord Yahweh, the holy one of Israel, said this:
“In returning and rest you shall be saved;
your strength shall be in quietness and in trust.”
But\f + \fr 30:15 \ft Or “And” \f* you were not willing,
and you said,
“No! For we will flee on horses!”\f + \fr 30:16 \ft Hebrew “horse” \f* Therefore you shall flee!
And, “We will ride on swift horses!”\f + \fr 30:16 \ft Hebrew “horse” \f* Therefore your pursuers shall be swift!
One thousand ⸤because of⸥\f + \fr 30:17 \ft Literally “from \fq the \ft face of” \f* a threat of one,
⸤because⸥\f + \fr 30:17 \ft Literally “from \fq the \ft face” \f* of a threat of five you shall flee,
until you are left like \add a\add* flagstaff on ⸤top⸥\f + \fr 30:17 \ft Literally “head” \f* of \add a\add* mountain,
and like \add a\add* signal on \add a\add* hill.
Yahweh Will Show Mercy
Therefore Yahweh waits to be gracious \add to\add* you,
and therefore he will rise up to show you mercy,
for Yahweh \add is\add* a God of justice;
blessed \add are\add* all those who wait for him.
For people will live in Zion;
in Jerusalem, you will surely not weep.
Surely he will be gracious to you;
when he hears the sound of your cry, he will answer you.
And the Lord will give you \add the\add* bread \add of\add* distress
and \add the\add* water \add of\add* oppression,
but\f + \fr 30:20 \ft Or “and” \f* your teachers will not hide themselves\f + \fr 30:20 \ft Hebrew “himself” \f* any longer.
And your eyes ⸤shall see⸥\f + \fr 30:20 \ft Literally “be seeing” \f* your teachers.
And your ears shall hear a word from behind you, saying,
“this \add is\add* the way; walk in it,”
when you go to your right
and when you go to your left.
And you will defile the plating of your silver idols
and the covering of your gold image.
You will scatter them like contaminated things;\f + \fr 30:22 \ft Hebrew “contaminated thing” \f*
you will say to it, “Filth!”\f + \fr 30:22 \ft Or “Get out!” \f*
And he will give rain for your seed \add with\add* which you sow the ground,
and grain, the produce of the ground, and it will be rich and ⸤fertile⸥.\f + \fr 30:23 \ft Literally “fat” \f*
On that day, your cattle will graze \add in\add* broad pastures;\f + \fr 30:23 \ft Hebrew “pasture” \f*
and the oxen and the donkeys that till\f + \fr 30:24 \ft Or “tilling” \f* the ground will eat fodder, sorrel
that \add has\add* been winnowed with shovel and pitchfork.
And there will be streams on every high mountain and elevated hill,
watercourses of water, on a day of great slaughter, when towers fall.
And the light of the full moon will be like the light of the sun,
and the light of the sun will be sevenfold, like the light of seven days,
on \add the\add* day \add when\add* Yahweh binds up the breakage of his people,
and he heals the wound of his blow.
Judgment against Assyria
Look! The name of Yahweh comes from afar,
burning \add with\add* his anger and heaviness of cloud.
His lips are full \add of\add* indignation,
and his tongue \add is\add* like a devouring fire.
And his breath \add is\add* like an overflowing river;
it reaches up to \add the\add* neck
to shake \add the\add* nations with \add the\add* sieve of worthlessness;
and a bridle that leads astray \add is\add* on \add the\add* jawbones of \add the\add* peoples.
⸤You shall have a song⸥\f + \fr 30:29 \ft Literally “There shall be a song for you” \f* as \add in\add* \add the\add* night when a holy festival is kept,
and a gladness of heart like one who goes with the flute,
to go to the mountain of Yahweh, to the rock of Israel.
And Yahweh will cause the majesty of his voice to be heard,
and he will cause the descent of his arm to be seen,
in furious anger and a flame of devouring fire,
\add with\add* a cloudburst and a rainstorm and stones\f + \fr 30:30 \ft Hebrew “stone” \f* of hail.
Indeed, Assyria will be shattered by the voice of Yahweh;
he strikes with the rod.
And every stroke of \add the\add* staff of foundation\f + \fr 30:32 \ft Some translations emend this to “discipline” \f* that Yahweh lays will be on it with timbrels and lyres,
and he will fight against it\f + \fr 30:32 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) has “them” \f* with battles of brandishing.
For Topheth has been prepared from yesterday;
indeed, it is made ready for the king.
He makes its pile of wood deep and wide;
he makes fire and wood ⸤abundant⸥.\f + \fr 30:33 \ft Literally “numerous” \f*
The breath of Yahweh burns in it like a stream of sulfur.
